channel.title: math.KT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.KT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Witt vectors and $\delta$-Cartier rings
item.description: arXiv:2409.03877v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We give a universal property of the construction of the ring of $p$-typical Witt vectors of a commutative ring, endowed with Witt vectors Frobenius and Verschiebung, and generalize this construction to the derived setting. We define an $\infty$-category of $p$-typical derived $\delta$-Cartier rings and show that the derived ring of $p$-typical Witt vectors of a derived ring is naturally an object in this $\infty$-category. Moreover, we show that for any prime $p$, the formation of the derived ring of $p$-typical Witt vectors gives an equivalence between the $\infty$-category of all derived rings and the full subcategory of all derived $p$-typical $\delta$-Cartier rings consisting of $V$-complete objects.
item.dc:creator: Kirill Magidson

item.title: Prismatic logarithm and prismatic Hochschild homology via norm
item.description: arXiv:2409.04400v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this brief note, we present an elementary construction of the first Chern class of Hodge--Tate crystals in line bundles using a refinement of the prismatic logarithm, which should be comparable to the one considered by Bhargav Bhatt. The key to constructing this refinement is Yuri Sulyma's norm on (animated) prisms. We explain the relation of this construction to prismatic Witt vectors, as a generalization of Kaledin's polynomial Witt vectors. We also propose the prismatic Hochschild homology as a noncommutative analogue of prismatic de Rham complex.
item.dc:creator: Zhouhang Mao

item.title: Ample groupoid homology and \'etale correspondences
item.description: arXiv:2304.13473v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We show that \'etale correspondences between ample groupoids induce homomorphisms of homology groups. To complement this we explore the module categories of ample groupoids. We construct an induction-restriction adjunction for subgroupoids, which generates a procedure for building resolutions of arbitrary groupoid modules. These resolutions can be used to work with the Tor picture of groupoid homology, enabling explicit descriptions of the maps in homology induced by \'etale correspondences.
item.dc:creator: Alistair Miller

item.title: Functors between Kasparov categories from \'etale groupoid correspondences
item.description: arXiv:2303.02089v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: For an \'etale correspondence $\Omega \colon G \to H$ of \'etale groupoids, we construct an induction functor $\mathrm{Ind}_\Omega \colon \mathrm{KK}^H \to \mathrm{KK}^G$ between equivariant Kasparov categories. We introduce the crossed product of an $H$-equivariant correspondence by $\Omega$, and use this to build a natural transformation $\alpha_\Omega \colon K_*( G \ltimes \mathrm{Ind}_\Omega -) \Rightarrow K_*(H \ltimes -)$. When $\Omega$ is proper these constructions naturally sit above an induced map in K-theory $K_*(C^*(G)) \to K_*(C^*(H))$.
item.dc:creator: Alistair Miller
